values.headline: Business Intelligence Architect at Royal Caribbean International

values.summary:
-Recognized for successfully completing 9.3 upgrade (from SAS 9.2) and SAS 9.2 upgrade (from SAS 9.1.3) for both development and production servers on time and under budget
-Implemented original SAS 9.1.3 on a new AIX production server
-Provided support for UNIX/AIX administration, SAS software development, SAS statistical models and Oracle and PC data support to users in various business units
-Coded SAS procedures to convert and manipulate a 500GB customer prospect database into a manageable SAS data set
-Utilized SAS Macro and PROC SQL writing and UNIX shell scripting skills
-Troubleshot issues via logs both at the server/services/start-up level as well as those in submitted SAS user processes/code -Worked with UNIX and Workstations team to resolve server/laptop issues outside of SAS
-Provided on-call support for production problem resolution
-Applied and followed-up on hot fixes where required
-Managed SAS access and security through Management Console access to metadata server
-Recommended system improvements including those involving sizing, memory utilization, performance impacts and temp file and user storage
-Documented server architecture as well as user-level processes and workstation installation
-Served as liason to SAS technical, sales, licensing and training support
-Continued to provide efficient and single-handed support to the BI SAS platform resulting in nearly 100% planned application up-time and services availability in spite of the increased overall system utilization by multiple business user departments
-Started and periodically host a local in-house SAS user group for training, new product demos and ultimately for the purpose of increased in-house SAS usage and ROI to the company
-Interfaced with SAS vendor and conducted SAS-sponsored training and introductory software demos for prospective internal users
–Met with SAS users periodically in various departments to review initiatives, to offer coding assistance and to provide training
values.title: SAS Architect/Lead

values.summary:
-Participated in OBIEE+ POC metadata and dashboard rollout for Marine business unit
-Successfully administered and configured Hyperion Performance Scorecard to users in Marine department in 2010
-Played a key role in the 2009 Hyperion Interactive Reporting System 9.3.1 Upgrade project from Brio 6.6, executed in partnership with an external vendor. The project team migrated 1,500 reporting users, domestic and international, using 1,800+ interactive reports and 1,650 scheduled reports.
-Led the effort in late 2009 and through 2011 to complete  Hyperion Interactive Reporting product upgrades to Service Pack 3 (9.3.1.3) and version 9.3.3 entirely with internal resources on time and under budget
-Ensured that Hyperion IR developers/contractors and Essbase developers on the BI team had sufficient assignments
-Interviewed and hired new Hyperion IR and Essbase contractors
-Gathered and documented Marketing Data Mart requirements in Rational Requisite Pro and relayed them to a third party consulting firm hired to implement the data mart
-Authored SOW consulting agreements and technical specification documents for Hyperion upgrades
-Installed and conducted a Siebel Analytics proof of concept demo for business users
-Created estimates for IT Data Warehouse or BI tool impact for new business user initiatives/projects
-Attended KPI Partner training in OBIEE+ Dashboard Building, January 2010 and OBIEE+ administration, November 2009
-Attended Hyperion Solutions 2007 and 2007 Oracle Open World

values.summary:

Administered WebLogic server clusters to host Java / J2EE enterprise applications. Wrote Disaster & Recovery plans.
Used eclipse IDE to write Java code (EJB, JSP, Struts, JSTL, Servlets, XML, SOAP, WSDL, JSON, REST, AXIS, JDBC, Spring, Hibernate, JPA, JMS). Wrote PL/SQL scripts to access and manipulate data in Oracle DB (stored procedures, triggers, functions, packages). Used various design patterns like Spring MVC, Factory, Façade, Adapter, Strategy, Singleton and many, others to write polymorphic, generic and reusable code for high scalability and extensibility. Performed build and release tasks using CVS, Maven, Hudson, SVN, Ant and GNUMake, Wrote shell scripts on Linux to automate daily programming tasks (AWK, sed, grep, RegEx).
values.title: Sr. Computer Software Consultant

values.summary:
I am a senior computer software engineer with over 12 years of hands on, writing code, programming experience (Java, C++, Oracle PL/SQL, MySQL, Python, PHP, Linux, Windows, Solaris / SunOS, Apache, Servlet/JSP on Tomcat / Jetty, EJB / MDB / JMS on JBoss / WebLogic / WebSphere, Spring, Hibernate).
I have been developing code in an Agile process for more than 5 years. 

I worked for small, medium and large companies like Hewlett-Packard, eBay, Ariba and Fujitsu just to name a few.

I used Scrum, Test Driven Methodology and xTreme Programming throughout the last 6 years of my computer programming experience. 
I wrote code, for many major and minor releases and patches, throughout all phases of the software development life cycle.
I am very experienced with the modern OOP design patterns (GoF) like Strategy, Facade, Singleton, Dynamic Proxy, Factory, Adapter just to name a few.
I can work on all tiers of the enterprise, multi-tier, application from the front end (HTML, CSS, JavaScript, AJAX, Prototype, jQuery, Dojo, ExtJS, GWT, YUI, MooTools, Canvas) to the middle tier (Servlet / JSP / JSTL, Struts, EJB, MDB, JMS, IoC & Dependency Injection with Spring and ORM / JPA with Hibernate) and all the way to the back end (Oracle PL/SQL, stored procedures, functions, packages, triggers, query tuning with Oracle Optimizer hints and indexes, TKPROF, SQLTrace etc.).
I am very comfortable writing code on both Windows and Linux platforms and I am EXTREMELY proficient with UNIX shell scripting (Bash, Korn, TCSH) and other 
interpreted languages like Python & Perl.

I have excellent communication skills and I can work equally well in a team environment or alone, with minimum supervision.

I am a self starter, motivated and goal oriented.

Attached is my resume for your review.

I am Canadian citizen.
I am also incorporated in British Columbia, Canada, so I can take (long / short) independent contracting projects.

values.summary:

* I am happy in my current position.
* I am not looking.
* I would never, ever, consider a position off of the San Francisco peninsula, nor south of the San Francisco airport. Ever.
* Not even if they have a shuttle.
That may sound harsh, but let's just agree to save ourselves a whole lot of time.

Extremely versatile software developer with over 20 years of experience, a record of producing tangible results and intellectual property, and a knack for helping teams be in the right place at the right time. values.headline: CTO at Handle.com

values.summary:
Handle offers a new email experience and consists of a backend server, a web frontend and an iOS app. Technologies: Rails, Heroku, Postgres, AWS S3, Resque, Mongo, EventMachine, Memcache, Knockout.js, Backbone.js, d3.js, crossfilter.js, rspec, iOS

* Engineered 90% reduction in technical debt, improvements in code quality and unit test effectiveness, as measured by retrospectives.
* Established automatic site monitoring systems through New Relic, live dashboards and in-house diagnostics solutions, reducing response time to serious issues to less then 60 minutes and improving uptime to > 99%.
* Led re-architecture effort to use Reactor Pattern with EventMachine for email retrieval, reducing email arrival latencies from > 5 minutes to < 5 seconds.
* Developed synchronization architecture to keep mobile and web clients sync'ed in real time through a mix of Operational Transforms and Opportunistic Concurrency.
* Optimized site scalability across two orders of magnitude in traffic increase.
* Built site analytics as a combination of Mixpanel and hand-crafted database queries visualized with dc.js, d3.js and crossfilter.js
* Conducted formal security audit with outside firm. No glaring problems were found.
* Directed a team of six engineers.
values.title: CTO

values.summary:
RubyFocus is a boutique consulting firm specializing in Ruby-on-Rails, based in San Francisco, CA.  We help our clients with:
* Iterating product market fit and taking applications to launch
* Securing and scaling their applications
* Conducting technical due diligence audits
* Forging a best practices culture and building world-class teams

Our clients and projects include:
* Handle.com. Set up core architecture and development culture for backend. Led single-page app development effort with backbone.js.
* Conducted due diligence and technical audits for various clients including Accenture and Battery Ventures.
* Yottamark. Advised company on app deployment strategy.
* Marakana and BlazingCloud (2009-2012). Rails instructor for week-long or evening developer training classes in Rails best practices and Test-Driven-Development.
* In collaboration with Blazingcloud.net: For the JCC in San Francisco, built a web-based CMS with Radiant and custom extensions, set up SOAP-based data feed from a legacy SQL Server database.
* Mightyverse.com. Turned demo site for language learning and sharing into a launched product, hosting on Heroku and using Postgres for multi-language full-text search. Trained Director of Engineering in Rails and TDD to take over development independently.
* FanSnap.com. Established Rails best practices and conventions, set up Continuous Integration, and Capistrano deployment. Developed features for the company's event ticket search in Rails and jQuery.
* EduFire.com. Built company's online learning site using Rails, Ajax and Javascript; trained CTO in Rails and TDD through remote pair-programming. Attached >95% test coverage which proved key for hiring talent.
* Papercheck.com Implemented PCI-compliant payment workflow with Paypal and Authorize.net. Designed fraud-prevention logic for online purchases.
values.title: Principal Consultant

values.summary:
Veteran technology leader recognized for:
* Transforming software organizations into strike teams of high cohesion
* Establishing Lean Startup cultural values including Test-Driven Development, Pair Programming and Continuous Deployment
* Enabling rapid product iteration by tightly controlling technical debt.
* Data-driven product strategy
* Leveraging the ecosystem of open source and cloud services to focus available resources on the building core business value.

Interested in:
* Companies building disruptive technologies in big data, machine learning, mobile
* Teams that become more than the sum of their parts

Specialties: Ruby-on-Rails, Javascript frameworks, reactor pattern, scaling web apps, app security, TDD (test-driven development), analytics and business intelligence, big data, payment systems, clean architecture; vibrant organizations of highly motivated teams; technical leadership.

designing and implementing applications for iPhone, iPad, and iPod Touch.

values.summary:
I create large, moving sculptures, usually made of aluminum, incorporating propane burners, LEDs, and microcontrollers.

My most recent work, Garden of Rockets, is my most ambitious.  It is three large sculptures propelled by the thrust of propane burners.  The throttle and direction of each burner is controlled remotely, allowing the visitor to bring about many kinds of motion.

values.summary:
Hello I'm James Sergent and I'm an Enterprise Security Engineer.  I Have worked with various Fortune 500 Banking, Insurance and Finance companies and Public Utilities in the Information Security Space. Having worked in Information Technology industry for more than 17 years. I specialize in Security/Identity Management Strategies, Methodologies and Architecture Review. As well as implementing these controls on Windows, UNIX and Linux Servers and assorted Applications.

I'm a Highly motivated and performance driven Information Security Subject Matter Expert with more than seventeen years of successful experience in Information Security is looking for a position in a progressive organizations where I can utilize my skills and knowledge to ensure an appropriate level of confidentiality, integrity, availability, authentication, and non-repudiation is administered and is based upon valid risk management decisions, using my Strong competency with Active Directory,, Migration & Support Public Key Infrastructure (PKI), PIV, HSPD-12, Common Access Cards (CACs) Card Readers, FIPS 201, NIST 800 series documents, X.509 Certificate Policy, Data-At-Rest, Cryptographic Logon (CLO), Certificate Revocation List (CRL), Online Certificate Status Protocol (OCSP) these tools are my foundation to ensuring the entire organization can securely resist the forces to which it may be subjected and meet the organization's business goals and objectives.

I'm a loyal, enthusiastic, dependable results-oriented professional who thrives in environments offering a challenge to provide new, Interactive solutions, with skills ranging from Planning & Development to Implementation, Data Management, IAMS & System Administration.  I am an effective leader and co-worker with the ability to empower co-workers, Management and Lead Teams to achieve stated objectives or be hands on in a systems engineering capacity or 24/7 Duty pager or Cell phone Disaster recovery projects.  

Thank you,

James Sergent
